title: Stylized Modular Neighborhood Kit
description: A cute, stylized modular neighborhood kit to build your own towns with. Complete with trees, foliage, roads and a tiling grass texture!
longDescription:
This, casual, stylized modular neighborhood building kit is perfect for your modern day game.


With fully modular building parts, you can create all sorts of buildings for your neighborhood. Complete with customizable material instances, you can create as many variations as you'd like.


Use the included road and sidewalk kit to help your players explore the town! Hide secrets or block your players out with several different fence styles, including chain link and privacy fences!


These assets have a high quality look, but are quite low poly and all meshes use the same material for optimal performance!


With an included demo scene you can see exactly how I used these pieces to quickly and easily put together a suburban neighborhood home!


This pack utilizes the PixPal palette created by Youtuber and 3D artist, Imphenzia. Check out his work here: https://youtu.be/glIc62osmys?si=LrkqC2rvXzecr8mK
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • 8 modular wall pieces
  • Â 5 modular door variations
  • 16 modular roof pieces
  • 15 modular fence pieces
  • 3 tree variations
  • 4 grass clump variations
  • 13 flower variations
  • 2 bush variations
  • 2 attic window pieces
  • 7 road and sidewalk variations
  • 4 stone path pieces
  • 9 stone variation pieces
  • Additional neighborhood accessories
  • Modular parts for snappable building workflow
  • Modular material instances to customize wall and roof meshes with color and roughness variables

Number of Unique Meshes: 106

Collision: Auto-generated

Vertex Count: 169,224 Total Meshes

LODs: No

Number of Materials and Material Instances: 2 Materials, 4 Material Instances

Number of Textures: 5

Texture Resolutions: Tileable Grass Texture: 2048, Tileable Noise: 1024, Mesh Color Palette: 128

Supported Development Platforms: Any

Windows: Yes

Mac: Yes

Documentation: https://www.discord.gg/kindredgames


Feel free to reach out to me directly if you have questions - michael@kindredgames.net
